meanings.definition: The basic monetary unit of Italy before the adoption of the euro.
meanings.sent1: In the past, people in Italy used lire to buy things.
meanings.sent2: I found an old coin that was worth many lire.
meanings.sent3: The lire in the piggy bank were like hidden treasures waiting to be spent.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was worth more than a thousand lire.
meanings.sent5: The sound of lire clinking together was music to his ears.

meanings.sent1: She will lire the poem at the school assembly.
meanings.sent2: I love to lire stories to my little sister before bedtime.
meanings.sent3: The parrot tried to lire the newspaper but got the words all mixed up.
meanings.sent4: His eyes seemed to lire the words off the page effortlessly.
meanings.sent5: The teacher asked him to lire the passage with confidence and clarity.

meanings.definition: A unit of currency in Lebanon and Syria.
meanings.sent1: When traveling to Lebanon, make sure to have enough lire for expenses.
meanings.sent2: The market only accepted lire as payment for the goods.
meanings.sent3: He dreamt of swimming in a pool filled with Lebanese lire.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness was worth more than any amount of lire.
meanings.sent5: The aroma of freshly baked bread filled the air as people exchanged lire for loaves.
